oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Tom T. Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Tom T. Hall (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date. Tape features a segment at the end called Five Minutes With Johnny Rodriguez. The segment features Johnny Rodriguez (musician) discussion with Phillips.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tom T. Hall; Rick Phillips; Johnny Rodriguez
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Country is [featuring Phillips commercial spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music program] (Tom. T. Hall) -- (00:18) Unidentified tune (Tom T. Hall) -- (00:38) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:10) Yogurt commercial spot hosted by unidentified voice -- (01:42) Salute to a Switchblade Knife (Tom T. Hall) -- (05:04) Hall reflects on his time in Germany while recalling "Salute to a Switchblade Knife;" additionally, Hall reflects on working as a song-writer -- (07:04) That Song is Driving Me Crazy (Tom T. Hall) -- (10:00) Feron Young radio spot about his military service -- (11:02) Reenlistment commercial spot hosted by Hall -- (12:19) Home Coming (Tom T. Hall) -- (15:31) Hall discusses the statement "Home Coming" makes, and Phillips asks as to why Hall left the Grand Ole Opry -- (18:50) That's How I Got to Memphis (Tom T. Hall) -- (21:35) Carpool commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (22:38) Country is (Tom T. Hall) -- (24:38) Phillips hosts a military housing commercial spot -- (25:12) One-Hundred Children (Tom T. Hall) -- (27:35) Hall reflects on his dream of a perfect world -- (30:07) The Promise and the Dream (Tom T. Hall) -- (32:50) Phillips radio spot for the Veteran's Office -- (33:03) A Week in Country Jail (Tom T. Hall) -- (35:58) Phillips inquires about how genuine "A Week in Country Jail" is; additionally, Hall and Phillips discuss the story of "Old Dogs, Children and Watermelon Wine" -- (37:50) Old Dogs, Children and Watermelon Wine (Tom T. Hall) -- (41:41) Military medical insurance commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (42:13) Shoe Shine Man (Tom T. Hall) -- (44:57) Phillips and Hall discuss how one draws inspiration for a story like "Shoe Shine Man" -- (46:53) I Love (Tom T. Hall) -- (48:53) Phillips performs a reenlistment commercial spot -- (49:30) The Year Clayton Delaney Died (Tom T. Hall) -- (52:06) Hall reveals the man who inspired "The Year Clayton Delaney Died," and both Hall and Phillips say goodbye -- (52:58) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:16) Ridin' My Thumb to Mexico (Johnny Rodriguez) -- (57:18) Rodriguez recalls stealing goats to feed himself and being brought before officers to perform -- (59:18) Unidentified outro tune
